wikipedia_page.main: Michael Biddulph, 1st Baron Biddulph JP DL (17 February 1834 – 6 April 1923) was a British banker and Liberal, later Liberal Unionist, Member of Parliament (MP).

link_mentions.page: List of political families in the United Kingdom
response: *** Michael Biddulph, 1st Baron Biddulph, son-in-law, MP for Herefordshire (1865–1880) and Ross (1885–1900)

Peel married, on 19 March 1824, Lady Alice Jane, youngest daughter of Archibald Kennedy, first Marquis of Ailsa, by whom he had eight children, five sons and three daughters. Their second son, Edmund Yates Peel, became a Lieutenant-Colonel in the Army. Their fourth son, John Peel, achieved the rank of Lieutenant-General in the Army. Their second daughter Alice married the diplomat Sir Robert Morier. Their youngest daughter, Adelaide Georgiana, married Michael Biddulph, 1st Baron Biddulph.
*Michael Biddulph, 1st Baron Biddulph (1834–1923), Liberal (Unionist) MP for Herefordshire (1865–1880) and Ross (1885–1900)Harrow, 1800–1911, p. 198

Michael Biddulph, 1st Baron Biddulph, was a descendant of Anthony Biddulph, uncle of Sir Theophilus Biddulph, 1st Baronet, of Westcombe (see Baron Biddulph for more information on this branch of the family).
* Michael Biddulph, 1st Baron Biddulph (1834–1923), English politician, Member of Parliament in Herefordshire
* № 19 Michael Biddulph, 1st Baron Biddulph, MP, banker, (1877–1915)
